headers: THREE PHASES OF THE LABOR SEQUENCE

rows.THREE PHASES OF THE LABOR SEQUENCE: BUILD the Trade. VALIDATE the Trade. DEPLOY the Trade.
PHASE 1: BUILD (Weeks 1-12)
Links: Nilo → VA → CoS → Recruiter → Lead PM
Goal: Produce the imagination asset. The complete first-draft Trade.
The imagination asset is the thing that makes everything downstream possible.
Without it, you're pitching a concept. With it, you're showing a machine.
An investor can see the 688 tabs. An expert can review their domain. A CEO candidate
can understand exactly what they'd be operating. It's not a pitch deck — it's the business itself,
pre-built, waiting for someone to turn it on.
The Lead PM is the key hire in this phase. They don't need to be a domain expert in anything.
They need to be organized, relentless, and comfortable using Claude as their primary tool.
They run the AI production loop: prompt Claude, review output, flag gaps, iterate.
Output: Complete first-draft Trade. Every tab filled. Not A-grade yet, but legible and complete.
PHASE 2: VALIDATE (Weeks 10-22)
Links: Cluster PMs → Venture Partners → Experts → Investors
Goal: Take the imagination asset from first draft to expert-grade. Get external validation.
Cluster PMs each own a domain. They take the Lead PM's draft and run the expert calibration
loop for their cluster. Each expert session improves the models AND generates introductions.
PMs find Venture Partners through their expert networks. VPs validate and connect.
This phase is where the Trade goes from 'impressive AI output' to 'credible operating system.'
Expert review is not just quality improvement — it's credibility accumulation.
Every expert who says 'this is actually good' is a proof point.
Every Venture Partner who introduces an investor is a validation signal.
The constraint is legibility. The Trade is too weird for most people to navigate raw.
Claude is the human interface. Every person in the chain interacts with the Trade through Claude.
The spreadsheet is the database. Claude is the UI. Nobody navigates 688 tabs directly.
Output: A-grade Trade. Expert-validated. Investor interest. Venture Partner network.
PHASE 3: DEPLOY (Weeks 22-30+)
Links: CEO Recruiter → CEO / Operator
Goal: Find and install the person who runs the business.
By this point, the CEO recruiter is pitching a funded company with an expert-validated
688-tab operating system, investor backing, a venture partner network, and a governance
framework (CM, School Model, semesters, graduation criteria).
That is a fundamentally different recruiting pitch than 'we have an idea for an electrolyte brand.'
The CEO/Operator enrolls in the School Model. Semester 1 begins. The Trade Execution Tracker
becomes the live project plan. The CM starts grading. The system runs.
Output: Revenue. Customers. A running business on track to graduation.
